USA: The Spanish Jesuit father Segura, along with seven other priests and a number of lay companions, established a mission, which, after a brief period of existence, was destroyed by the natives, the whole company being massacred excepting one Indian boy.
Poland: Signing of the Treaty of Stettin concludes the Northern Seven Years' War
Philippine: The Portuguese again attack the colony and are repulsed.
Legazpi sends an expedition under the leadership of Martin de Goiti to Manila.
Lebanon: The Maanid period reaches its peak with the reign of Fakhr ad-Din II. (to 1635)
Japan: Oda Nobunaga have started a 10-year long Ishiyama Hongan-ji War to suppress the warrior monks community and Kaga ikki state.
Ireland: Pope Pius V issued a papal bull, Regnans in Excelsis, declaring Elizabeth I of England a heretic and releasing her subjects from any allegiance to her.
Indonesia: Sultan Hairun of Ternate is killed by the Portuguese. The reign of Sultan Baabullah.
Cyprus: Ottoman Turks invade Cyprus with 80,000 men.
Nicosia falls to the Turkish invaders. 20,000 Nicosians, Greek and Latin, are killed in the aftermath. About 1,000 survivors are bound and shipped out to be sold in the Constantinople slave markets.
Chile: Concepción is struck by an earthquake.
